title: Create development plan (PLAN.md) based on PRODUCT-REQUIREMENTS-SPECIFICATION v1.0.0
description:
## WHAT
Create a comprehensive development plan document (PLAN.md) that translates the approved PRODUCT-REQUIREMENTS-SPECIFICATION.md v1.0.0 into an actionable implementation roadmap.

## WHY
The specification defines WHAT to build, but we need a plan that defines HOW and WHEN to build it. This plan will:
- Break down the 15 functional requirements into manageable epics and tasks
- Define dependencies between components to ensure correct build order
- Provide effort estimates for resource planning
- Serve as the source for creating all bd issues to track development progress

## HOW
1. Analyze PRODUCT-REQUIREMENTS-SPECIFICATION.md to identify all functional requirements (FR-001 to FR-015)
2. Group related FRs into development phases/epics
3. Break each epic into concrete implementation tasks and subtasks
4. Map dependencies between tasks (what must be built first)
5. Add effort estimates (T-shirt sizing or story points)
6. Define a suggested timeline/milestone structure
7. Document in history/PLAN.md following project conventions
close_reason: Completed: Created comprehensive PLAN.md based on PRS v1.0.0 with 5 phases, 40+ tasks, effort estimates, and DoD. Also created full BD issue tracking structure (6 epics, 40 tasks, 80 subtasks = 126 issues total) directly from PLAN.md.

title: Review actual product requirements
description: Review the document until reach production ready (no-draft)
close_reason: Document finalized as v1.0.0 - Approved and ready for implementation

title: Integrate handler and seed loaders into runner
description:
## Bug: Handler and Seed Loaders Not Integrated into Runner

### Original Problem
The runner (openapi-server-runner.mts) receives handlersDir and seedsDir via environment variables but never uses them. The loaders (handler-loader.ts, seed-loader.ts) exist but are not called from the runner.

### Root Cause Analysis (Discovered)

**The implementation diverged completely from the PRD and PLAN specifications.**

#### What Was Specified (PRD FR-004 + Scalar Docs):

1. **Handler Format** - Object mapping operationId â†’ JS code:
   - **Static**: `operationId: "JS code string"` (literal code)
   - **Dynamic**: `operationId: (context) => "JS code string"` (function that generates code based on OpenAPI context)

2. **Seed Format** - Object mapping schemaName â†’ JS code:
   - **Static**: `schemaName: "JS code string"`
   - **Dynamic**: `schemaName: (context) => "JS code string"`

3. **Document Enhancer (P2-03)** - Inject x-handler/x-seed extensions into OpenAPI spec

4. **Scalar Integration** - Pass enhanced spec to createMockServer(), Scalar executes x-handler/x-seed code automatically with helpers (store, faker, req, res, seed)

#### What Was Implemented (Incorrectly):

1. **Handler Format**: Single async function as default export that returns response directly
2. **Seed Format**: Single async function as default export that returns data directly  
3. **Document Enhancer**: NOT IMPLEMENTED
4. **Scalar Integration**: NOT IMPLEMENTED - Scalar receives plain spec without extensions

### Scalar Mock Server Documentation

- x-handler: https://scalar.com/products/mock-server/custom-request-handler
- x-seed: https://scalar.com/products/mock-server/data-seeding

Scalar expects:
- `x-handler`: JS code string in operation objects (paths[path][method]['x-handler'])
- `x-seed`: JS code string in schema objects (components.schemas[name]['x-seed'])

### Solution: Rewrite to Follow PRD (Option A)

1. **Rewrite handler-loader.ts**:
   - Load files that export objects: `{ operationId: string | ((ctx) => string) }`
   - Support both static (string) and dynamic (functionâ†’string) formats
   - Validate against OpenAPI operations

title: Update handler and seed type definitions
description:
Update types/handlers.ts and types/seeds.ts to match PRD specification.

## Handler Types
- HandlerValue = string | ((context: HandlerCodeContext) => string | Promise<string>)
- HandlerExports = Record<string, HandlerValue> (operationId â†’ code)
- HandlerCodeContext = { operationId, operation, method, path, document, schemas }

## Seed Types  
- SeedValue = string | ((context: SeedCodeContext) => string | Promise<string>)
- SeedExports = Record<string, SeedValue> (schemaName â†’ code)
- SeedCodeContext = { schemaName, schema, document, schemas }

## Files
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/types/handlers.ts
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/types/seeds.ts
close_reason: Rewrote handler and seed type definitions to match PRD code-based format. New types: HandlerCodeContext, HandlerValue, HandlerExports, SeedCodeContext, SeedValue, SeedExports. Removed deprecated function-based types.

title: Rewrite handler-loader to load object exports
description:
Rewrite handler-loader.ts to follow PRD specification.

## Current (Wrong)
- Expects: export default async function handler(ctx) { return response }
- Returns: Map<operationId, function>

## Required (PRD)
- Expects: export default { operationId: 'code' | (ctx) => 'code' }
- Returns: Map<operationId, HandlerValue> (string or function that returns string)

## Implementation
1. Scan for *.handler.{ts,js,mts,mjs} files
2. Dynamic import each file
3. Validate default export is an object (not function)
4. Validate each value is string or function
5. If function, validate it returns string (call with mock context)
6. Cross-reference operationIds with registry
7. Return Map<string, HandlerValue>

## Files
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/loaders/handler-loader.ts
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/loaders/__tests__/handler-loader.test.ts
close_reason: Rewrote handler-loader to load object exports. Handler files now export { operationId: string | fn } format. Returns HandlerLoadResult with handlers Map, loadedFiles, warnings, errors. Updated all tests and fixtures.

title: Rewrite seed-loader to load object exports
description:
Rewrite seed-loader.ts to follow PRD specification.

## Current (Wrong)
- Expects: export default async function seed(ctx) { return data[] }
- Returns: Map<schemaName, function>

## Required (PRD)
- Expects: export default { schemaName: 'code' | (ctx) => 'code' }
- Returns: Map<schemaName, SeedValue> (string or function that returns string)

## Implementation
1. Scan for *.seed.{ts,js,mts,mjs} files
2. Dynamic import each file
3. Validate default export is an object (not function)
4. Validate each value is string or function
5. If function, validate it returns string
6. Cross-reference schemaNames with registry.schemas
7. Return Map<string, SeedValue>

## Files
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/loaders/seed-loader.ts
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/loaders/__tests__/seed-loader.test.ts
close_reason: Rewritten seed-loader to load object exports { schemaName: string | fn }. Updated fixtures and 59 tests passing.

title: Implement document-enhancer (P2-03)
description:
Implement document-enhancer.ts as specified in PLAN.md P2-03.

## Purpose
Clone OpenAPI spec and inject x-handler/x-seed extensions for Scalar mock server.

## Implementation
1. Deep clone OpenAPI spec (structuredClone or JSON parse/stringify)
2. For each handler entry:
   - Find operation by operationId in spec.paths
   - Resolve code: if function, call with HandlerCodeContext to get string
   - Inject operation['x-handler'] = resolvedCode
   - Log injection
3. For each seed entry:
   - Find schema by name in spec.components.schemas
   - Resolve code: if function, call with SeedCodeContext to get string
   - Inject schema['x-seed'] = resolvedCode
   - Log injection
4. Handle preservation: warn if x-handler/x-seed already exists (external overrides)
5. Return enhanced spec

## Function Signature
enhanceDocument(
  spec: OpenAPIV3_1.Document,
  handlers: Map<string, HandlerValue>,
  seeds: Map<string, SeedValue>,
  logger: Logger
): Promise<OpenAPIV3_1.Document>

## Files
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/enhancer/document-enhancer.ts (create)
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/enhancer/index.ts (create)
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/enhancer/__tests__/document-enhancer.test.ts (create)
close_reason: Implemented document-enhancer with value resolution. enhanceDocument() is now async and resolves static/dynamic handler/seed values to code strings before injection. 49 tests passing.

title: Integrate loaders and enhancer into runner
description:
Update openapi-server-runner.mts to use handlers, seeds, and document enhancement.

## Current State
- Runner receives HANDLERS_DIR and SEEDS_DIR via env vars
- Values are read but NEVER USED
- Scalar receives plain spec without x-handler/x-seed

## Required Changes
1. Import loadHandlers from loaders/handler-loader
2. Import loadSeeds from loaders/seed-loader
3. Import enhanceDocument from enhancer/document-enhancer
4. After parsing spec and building registry:
   - Call loadHandlers(handlersDir, registry, logger) if handlersDir provided
   - Call loadSeeds(seedsDir, registry, logger) if seedsDir provided
   - Call enhanceDocument(spec, handlers, seeds, logger)
5. Pass ENHANCED spec to createMockServer({ document: enhancedSpec })
6. Log summary of loaded handlers/seeds

## Files
- packages/vite-plugin-open-api-server/src/runner/openapi-server-runner.mts

title: End-to-end test with playground
description:
Test the complete integration with playground petstore app.

## Test Scenarios

### 1. Seed Data Loading
- Start playground with pnpm playground
- Call GET /pet/findByStatus?status=available
- Verify returns seeded pets (not empty/generic mocks)
- Verify pet data matches seed format (has name, category, tags, etc.)

### 2. Custom Handler Execution
- Call GET /pet/{petId} with valid ID
- Verify returns pet from store (seeded data)
- Call POST /pet with new pet data
- Verify pet is created in store
- Call GET /pet/{petId} with new ID
- Verify returns newly created pet

### 3. Handler/Seed Logging
- Check console output shows loaded handlers
- Check console output shows loaded seeds
- Check console output shows x-handler/x-seed injections

### 4. Error Handling
- Test with invalid handler file (syntax error)
- Verify other handlers still load
- Test with operationId that doesn't exist
- Verify warning is logged

## Success Criteria
- Custom handlers are executed instead of generic mocks
- Seed data populates store on startup
- store.list(), store.get(), store.create() work correctly
- faker generates realistic data in seeds
close_reason: End-to-end test successful: Fixed fast-glob import for CJS compatibility, converted playground files to .mjs, verified handler/seed loading (19 handlers, 5 seeds), confirmed x-handler/x-seed injection working with Scalar
